instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no green light wont power on
threads.message:
macbook came in not working with no green light and not coming on, 

replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and it worked, charged it to 100% and customer took it back 

customer plugged in his charger and it looks like that killed it again, 

missing green light again, replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> AGAIN, but this time no luck

<DIODE>D7005</DIODE> pin 1- 16.54V     PIN 2 - 12.6V    PIN 3 - 16.27V

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.4V

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> - missing  does not pulse,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no green light wont power on

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no green light wont power on
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/1 voltages.
Did you try another DCIN board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no green light wont power on
threads.message:
issue was the DC Jack, i had total of 3 bad ones, such a waste of time, sorry

Thank you guys, solved!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no green light wont power on
threads.message:
Is an easy repair.
There should be burnt small resistor/coil in serie with central pin.
